ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I'd highly recommend it to anyone interested in mesoscopic physics.
Yes, if the student has an interest in Mesoscopic Physics, he should take this course. It is an essential course for those working in this field.
It's a good course to open your view, but need much more learning to use it.

This was a very good introductory course for Mesoscopic Physics, which is a broad and fascinating topic. I would recommend it for students who have taken some advance physics courses (particularly Solid State), since they will be able to understand the material much better. It will require a lot of outside reading if you really want to learn the details and derivations of equations.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It's closely related to my research interests. I was able to relate a lot of the topics covered in class to what's going on in the lab.
This topic was not directly connected to my research but provided another point of view.

I took this course to familiarize myself with a topic I have had interest but little experience in. It definitely widened my understanding of the topic and contributed to my general physics knowledge.
